channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: How I Created a Detailed Dashboard for All of My Self-Hosted Apps
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Who needs bookmarks when you have a dashboard?
item.content:encoded: Are you tired of trying to remember IPs and ports for your self-hosted apps? I finally figured out how to make my homelab easier to manage—a detailed dashboard of all my services.

item.title: Charge Your iPhone 17 Faster and Smarter With the Baseus PicoGo II Series
item.dc:creator: Sponsored
item.description: This article is sponsored by Baseus.
item.content:encoded: The Apple iPhone 17 series is here, bringing a new level of performance and plenty of polish, but, once again, no charger in the box. And if you’ve been using the same old adapter from years past, you’re probably not getting the speed or efficiency these new phones can actually handle.

item.title: How to Back Up Your Google Photos Library to a Hard Drive
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Don't let cloud storage be your only backup.
item.content:encoded: Google Photos has been my primary method for backing up photos and videos for nearly a decade. I recently had the realization that it would be Very Bad if something ever happened to it, so I finally took the time to back up all my photos to an external hard drive, too.

item.title: 10 Daniel Day-Lewis Movies to Watch Before His Big Comeback
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: You need to see these Daniel Day-Lewis films before witnessing his return to the big screen.
item.content:encoded: This year will mark the return of the legendary actor Daniel Day-Lewis. He’s coming out of retirement to star in Anemone, a psychological drama directed and co-written by his son, Ronan Day-Lewis, that hits theaters on October 10. The Academy Award-winning actor will play a former soldier who returns from his hermit life in the woods to be reunited with his brother.

item.title: I'm Begging Google to Make Pixel Over-Ear Headphones
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: A solid pair of over-ear headphones from Google is long overdue.
item.content:encoded: Google wrapped up this year's announcements with the release of the Pixel 10 series, the Pixel Watch 4, and, in the audio department, the Pixel Buds 2a. Before this, we saw the release of the Pixel Buds Pro 2. These are all awesome, but the product I actually wanted doesn't exist yet: over-ear Pixel headphones. Can you imagine?

item.title: Switching to Linux: How to Replace Everyday Apps With Open-Source Alternatives
item.dc:creator: JT McGinty
item.description: You won't miss Windows one bit with these apps on your desktop!
item.content:encoded: Switching to Linux is exciting, but let’s be honest. One of the first things that hits you is the question: “What about my apps?” For years you’ve probably relied on Microsoft Office, Photoshop, OneDrive, or similar tools. The good news is that Linux has a thriving ecosystem of open source applications that can step in for your everyday needs. Even better, most of them can be installed and used within minutes, no complicated setup required.

item.title: Why Do They Keep Messing With the Colors in Our Movies?
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: From Silver Screen to Home Theater: The Surprising Truth About Movie Color Alterations
item.content:encoded: The curse of the physical collector has always been changes to newer formats. Just when your LaserDisc or VHS collection is looking great, DVD comes out, and you have to buy the better version of movies you already own, then rinse and repeat with Blu-ray, and now 4K UHD.

item.title: Proton Mail's Mobile Apps Just Got a Revamp
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Faster and more feature parity across Android and iOS.
item.content:encoded: Proton Mail is rolling out brand-new mobile apps for iOS and Android, which have been rebuilt from the ground up to be faster, more intuitive, and to provide a more private inbox experience. The new apps are available today.

item.title: This Goal Zero Home Backup Power Station Is Worth the Price and Effort
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Delivering reliable power when I need it most.
item.content:encoded: A backup power system is a great idea in case of emergencies, but it's a must for homeowners living somewhere affected by bad weather and hurricanes. That's why I have a whole-home backup setup powered by the Goal Zero Yeti Pro 4000 and the Haven 10 transfer switch. After dealing with several storms and a power outage, I'm confident saying that it's worth the price and effort.

item.title: Apple Has an Answer To All Those iPhone 17 Pro Scratches
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: In case you've been living under a rock, it looks like the iPhone 17 Pro's unibody aluminum design is, like, really prone to scratches. Like, a lot. Apple, for its part, seems to just be playing off concerns.
